Posts.EditableText:
I've been perusing the forum posts, and I've found a few things referencing a SetTimeout causing errors when 'playing' a walk-through, but I didn't find any ways around it.

Did I miss something during the search?

Or is that just the way it is, since walk-throughs are really designed for testing purposes anyway?

(As long as it doesn't effect loading from a saved game (which it doesn't), I'm fine.  But it would be nice to fix this during testing.)
Posts.HTML:
I've been perusing the forum posts, and I've found a few things referencing a SetTimeout causing errors when 'playing' a walk-through, but I didn't find any ways around it.

Did I miss something during the search?

Or is that just the way it is, since walk-throughs are really designed for testing purposes anyway?

(As long as it doesn't effect loading from a saved game (which it doesn't), I'm fine. But it would be nice to fix this during testing.)

Posts.EditableText: A walkthrough does everything at once, so generally a timeout will not have happened before the walkthrough completes. I am not aware of anything besides that.
Posts.HTML: A walkthrough does everything at once, so generally a timeout will not have happened before the walkthrough completes. I am not aware of anything besides that.

Posts.EditableText: I've just got my first few rooms set up strangely.  Otherwise, there would be no problems at all.  As long as I start my walkthrough after my fourth command, it's all good!  (Loading a saved game poses no problems whatsoever, so, meh.)
